intro: Casearia altiplanensis, commonly known as the Andean casearia, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly the Andes. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
